entries.content: Objections are just requests for more information, not rejections.
entries.notes: Speaker treats objections as opportunities to gather more info rather than seeing them as barriers.

entries.content: When told someone is no longer at the company, ask who replaced them to keep the conversation going.
entries.notes: Turns a potential dead-end into a chance to get new contact info.

entries.content: "Who took over?" after being told the contact left.
entries.notes: Simple phrase that reframes the objection as an info request.

entries.content: Old data isn't an excuse - you can still get valuable info by calling.
entries.notes: Challenges the common objection about outdated contact lists.

entries.content: Make light of incorrect info to ease into getting the correct name.
entries.notes: Uses humor to disarm gatekeepers when info is wrong.

focus_area: Objection Mindset: Objections = info requests, not rejections
